groups.name: camel.faulttolerance
groups.description: Fault Tolerance EIP Circuit Breaker configurations

groups.name: camel.lra
groups.description: Camel Saga EIP (Long Running Actions) configurations

properties.name: camel.main.allowUseOriginalMessage
properties.description: Sets whether to allow access to the original message from Camel's error handler, or from org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork.getOriginalInMessage(). Turning this off can optimize performance, as defensive copy of the original message is not needed. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.autoConfigurationEnabled
properties.description: Whether auto configuration of components, dataformats, languages is enabled or not. When enabled the configuration parameters are loaded from the properties component. You can prefix the parameters in the properties file with: - camel.component.name.option1=value1 - camel.component.name.option2=value2 - camel.dataformat.name.option1=value1 - camel.dataformat.name.option2=value2 - camel.language.name.option1=value1 - camel.language.name.option2=value2 Where name is the name of the component, dataformat or language such as seda,direct,jaxb. The auto configuration also works for any options on components that is a complex type (not standard Java type) and there has been an explicit single bean instance registered to the Camel registry via the org.apache.camel.spi.Registry#bind(String,Object) method or by using the org.apache.camel.BindToRegistry annotation style. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.autoConfigurationEnvironmentVariablesEnabled
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should include OS environment variables as well. When enabled this allows to overrule any configuration using an OS environment variable. For example to set a shutdown timeout of 5 seconds: CAMEL_MAIN_SHUTDOWNTIMEOUT=5. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.autoConfigurationFailFast
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should fail fast when configuring one ore more properties fails for whatever reason such as a invalid property name, etc. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.autoConfigurationLogSummary
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should log a summary with the configured properties. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.autoConfigurationSystemPropertiesEnabled
properties.description: Whether auto configuration should include JVM system properties as well. When enabled this allows to overrule any configuration using a JVM system property. For example to set a shutdown timeout of 5 seconds: -D camel.main.shutdown-timeout=5. Note that JVM system properties take precedence over OS environment variables. This option is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.autoStartup
properties.description: Sets whether the object should automatically start when Camel starts. Important: Currently only routes can be disabled, as CamelContext's are always started. Note: When setting auto startup false on CamelContext then that takes precedence and no routes are started. You would need to start CamelContext explicit using the org.apache.camel.CamelContext.start() method, to start the context, and then you would need to start the routes manually using CamelContext.getRouteController().startRoute(String). Default is true to always start up.

properties.name: camel.main.autowiredEnabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc. Default is true.

properties.name: camel.main.backlogTracing
properties.description: Sets whether backlog tracing is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.basePackageScan
properties.description: Package name to use as base (offset) for classpath scanning of RouteBuilder , and org.apache.camel.TypeConverter classes. If you are using Spring Boot then it is instead recommended to use Spring Boots component scanning and annotate your route builder classes with Component. In other words only use this for Camel Main in standalone mode.

properties.name: camel.main.basePackageScanEnabled
properties.description: Whether base package scan is enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.beanIntrospectionExtendedStatistics
properties.description: Sets whether bean introspection uses extended statistics. The default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.beanIntrospectionLoggingLevel
properties.description: Sets the logging level used by bean introspection, logging activity of its usage. The default is TRACE.

properties.name: camel.main.beanPostProcessorEnabled
properties.description: Can be used to turn off bean post processing. Be careful to turn this off, as this means that beans that use Camel annotations such as org.apache.camel.EndpointInject , org.apache.camel.ProducerTemplate , org.apache.camel.Produce , org.apache.camel.Consume etc will not be injected and in use. Turning this off should only be done if you are sure you do not use any of these Camel features. Not all runtimes allow turning this off (such as camel-blueprint or camel-cdi with XML). The default value is true (enabled).

properties.name: camel.main.camelEventsTimestampEnabled
properties.description: Whether to include timestamps for all emitted Camel Events. Enabling this allows to know fine-grained at what time each event was emitted, which can be used for reporting to report exactly the time of the events. This is by default false to avoid the overhead of including this information.

properties.name: camel.main.caseInsensitiveHeaders
properties.description: Whether to use case sensitive or insensitive headers. Important: When using case sensitive (this is set to false). Then the map is case sensitive which means headers such as content-type and Content-Type are two different keys which can be a problem for some protocols such as HTTP based, which rely on case insensitive headers. However case sensitive implementations can yield faster performance. Therefore use case sensitive implementation with care. Default is true.

properties.name: camel.main.configurationClasses
properties.description: Sets classes names that will be used to configure the camel context as example by providing custom beans through org.apache.camel.BindToRegistry annotation.

properties.name: camel.main.configurations
properties.description: Sets the configuration objects used to configure the camel context.

properties.name: camel.main.consumerTemplateCacheSize
properties.description: Consumer template endpoints cache size.

properties.name: camel.main.contextReloadEnabled
properties.description: Used for enabling context reloading. If enabled then Camel allow external systems such as security vaults (AWS secrets manager, etc.) to trigger refreshing Camel by updating property placeholders and reload all existing routes to take changes into effect.

properties.name: camel.main.debugging
properties.description: Sets whether debugging is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.description
properties.description: Sets the description (intended for humans) of the Camel application.

properties.name: camel.main.devConsoleEnabled
properties.description: Whether to enable developer console (requires camel-console on classpath). The developer console is only for assisting during development. This is NOT for production usage.

properties.name: camel.main.dumpRoutes
properties.description: If dumping is enabled then Camel will during startup dump all loaded routes (incl rests and route templates) represented as XML DSL into the log. This is intended for trouble shooting or to assist during development. Sensitive information that may be configured in the route endpoints could potentially be included in the dump output and is therefore not recommended being used for production usage. This requires to have camel-xml-jaxb on the classpath to be able to dump the routes as XML.

properties.name: camel.main.durationHitExitCode
properties.description: Sets the exit code for the application if duration was hit

properties.name: camel.main.durationMaxAction
properties.description: Controls whether the Camel application should shutdown the JVM, or stop all routes, when duration max is triggered.

properties.name: camel.main.durationMaxIdleSeconds
properties.description: To specify for how long time in seconds Camel can be idle before automatic terminating the JVM. You can use this to run Camel for a short while.

properties.name: camel.main.durationMaxMessages
properties.description: To specify how many messages to process by Camel before automatic terminating the JVM. You can use this to run Camel for a short while.

properties.name: camel.main.durationMaxSeconds
properties.description: To specify for how long time in seconds to keep running the JVM before automatic terminating the JVM. You can use this to run Camel for a short while.

properties.name: camel.main.endpointBridgeErrorHandler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.endpointLazyStartProducer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.endpointRuntimeStatisticsEnabled
properties.description: Sets whether endpoint runtime statistics is enabled (gathers runtime usage of each incoming and outgoing endpoints). The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.exchangeFactory
properties.description: Controls whether to pool (reuse) exchanges or create new exchanges (prototype). Using pooled will reduce JVM garbage collection overhead by avoiding to re-create Exchange instances per message each consumer receives. The default is prototype mode.

properties.name: camel.main.exchangeFactoryCapacity
properties.description: The capacity the pool (for each consumer) uses for storing exchanges. The default capacity is 100.

properties.name: camel.main.exchangeFactoryStatisticsEnabled
properties.description: Configures whether statistics is enabled on exchange factory.

properties.name: camel.main.extraShutdownTimeout
properties.description: Extra timeout in seconds to graceful shutdown Camel. When Camel is shutting down then Camel first shutdown all the routes (shutdownTimeout). Then additional services is shutdown (extraShutdownTimeout).

properties.name: camel.main.fileConfigurations
properties.description: Directory to load additional configuration files that contains configuration values that takes precedence over any other configuration. This can be used to refer to files that may have secret configuration that has been mounted on the file system for containers. You can specify a pattern to load from sub directories and a name pattern such as /var/app/secret/.properties, multiple directories can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.main.globalOptions
properties.description: Sets global options that can be referenced in the camel context Important: This has nothing to do with property placeholders, and is just a plain set of key/value pairs which are used to configure global options on CamelContext, such as a maximum debug logging length etc.

properties.name: camel.main.inflightRepositoryBrowseEnabled
properties.description: Sets whether the inflight repository should allow browsing each inflight exchange. This is by default disabled as there is a very slight performance overhead when enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.javaRoutesExcludePattern
properties.description: Used for exclusive filtering RouteBuilder classes which are collected from the registry or via classpath scanning. The exclusive filtering takes precedence over inclusive filtering. The pattern is using Ant-path style pattern. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma. For example to exclude all classes starting with Bar use: **/Bar* To exclude all routes form a specific package use: com/mycompany/bar/* To exclude all routes form a specific package and its sub-packages use double wildcards: com/mycompany/bar/** And to exclude all routes from two specific packages use: com/mycompany/bar/*,com/mycompany/stuff/*

properties.name: camel.main.javaRoutesIncludePattern
properties.description: Used for inclusive filtering RouteBuilder classes which are collected from the registry or via classpath scanning. The exclusive filtering takes precedence over inclusive filtering. The pattern is using Ant-path style pattern. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma. For example to include all classes starting with Foo use: **/Foo To include all routes form a specific package use: com/mycompany/foo/* To include all routes form a specific package and its sub-packages use double wildcards: com/mycompany/foo/** And to include all routes from two specific packages use: com/mycompany/foo/*,com/mycompany/stuff/*

properties.name: camel.main.jmxEnabled
properties.description: Enable JMX in your Camel application.

properties.name: camel.main.jmxManagementMBeansLevel
properties.description: Sets the mbeans registration level. The default value is Default.

properties.name: camel.main.jmxManagementNamePattern
properties.description: The naming pattern for creating the CamelContext JMX management name. The default pattern is #name#

properties.name: camel.main.jmxManagementStatisticsLevel
properties.description: Sets the JMX statistics level, the level can be set to Extended to gather additional information The default value is Default.

properties.name: camel.main.lightweight
properties.description: Configure the context to be lightweight. This will trigger some optimizations and memory reduction options. Lightweight context have some limitations. At this moment, dynamic endpoint destinations are not supported.

properties.name: camel.main.loadHealthChecks
properties.description: Whether to load custom health checks by scanning classpath.

properties.name: camel.main.loadStatisticsEnabled
properties.description: Sets whether context load statistics is enabled (something like the unix load average). The statistics requires to have camel-management on the classpath as JMX is required. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.loadTypeConverters
properties.description: Whether to load custom type converters by scanning classpath. This is used for backwards compatibility with Camel 2.x. Its recommended to migrate to use fast type converter loading by setting Converter(loader = true) on your custom type converter classes.

properties.name: camel.main.logDebugMaxChars
properties.description: Is used to limit the maximum length of the logging Camel message bodies. If the message body is longer than the limit, the log message is clipped. Use -1 to have unlimited length. Use for example 1000 to log at most 1000 characters.

properties.name: camel.main.logExhaustedMessageBody
properties.description: Sets whether to log exhausted message body with message history. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.logMask
properties.description: Sets whether log mask is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.mdcLoggingKeysPattern
properties.description: Sets the pattern used for determine which custom MDC keys to propagate during message routing when the routing engine continues routing asynchronously for the given message. Setting this pattern to will propagate all custom keys. Or setting the pattern to foo,bar will propagate any keys starting with either foo or bar. Notice that a set of standard Camel MDC keys are always propagated which starts with camel. as key name. The match rules are applied in this order (case insensitive): 1. exact match, returns true 2. wildcard match (pattern ends with a and the name starts with the pattern), returns true 3. regular expression match, returns true 4. otherwise returns false

properties.name: camel.main.messageHistory
properties.description: Sets whether message history is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.modeline
properties.description: Whether camel-k style modeline is also enabled when not using camel-k. Enabling this allows to use a camel-k like experience by being able to configure various settings using modeline directly in your route source code.

properties.name: camel.main.name
properties.description: Sets the name of the CamelContext.

properties.name: camel.main.producerTemplateCacheSize
properties.description: Producer template endpoints cache size.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerBackOffDelay
properties.description: Backoff delay in millis when restarting a route that failed to startup.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerBackOffMaxAttempts
properties.description: Backoff maximum number of attempts to restart a route that failed to startup. When this threshold has been exceeded then the controller will give up attempting to restart the route, and the route will remain as stopped.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerBackOffMaxDelay
properties.description: Backoff maximum delay in millis when restarting a route that failed to startup.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerBackOffMaxElapsedTime
properties.description: Backoff maximum elapsed time in millis, after which the backoff should be considered exhausted and no more attempts should be made.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerBackOffMultiplier
properties.description: Backoff multiplier to use for exponential backoff. This is used to extend the delay between restart attempts.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerExcludeRoutes
properties.description: Pattern for filtering routes to be excluded as supervised. The pattern is matching on route id, and endpoint uri for the route. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma. For example to exclude all JMS routes, you can say jms:. And to exclude routes with specific route ids mySpecialRoute,myOtherSpecialRoute. The pattern supports wildcards and uses the matcher from org.apache.camel.support.PatternHelper#matchPattern.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerIncludeRoutes
properties.description: Pattern for filtering routes to be included as supervised. The pattern is matching on route id, and endpoint uri for the route. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma. For example to include all kafka routes, you can say kafka:. And to include routes with specific route ids myRoute,myOtherRoute. The pattern supports wildcards and uses the matcher from org.apache.camel.support.PatternHelper#matchPattern.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerInitialDelay
properties.description: Initial delay in milli seconds before the route controller starts, after CamelContext has been started.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerLoggingLevel
properties.description: Sets the logging level used for logging route activity (such as starting and stopping routes). The default logging level is DEBUG.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerSuperviseEnabled
properties.description: To enable using supervising route controller which allows Camel to startup and then the controller takes care of starting the routes in a safe manner. This can be used when you want to startup Camel despite a route may otherwise fail fast during startup and cause Camel to fail to startup as well. By delegating the route startup to the supervising route controller then its manages the startup using a background thread. The controller allows to be configured with various settings to attempt to restart failing routes.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerThreadPoolSize
properties.description: The number of threads used by the route controller scheduled thread pool that are used for restarting routes. The pool uses 1 thread by default, but you can increase this to allow the controller to concurrently attempt to restart multiple routes in case more than one route has problems starting.

properties.name: camel.main.routeControllerUnhealthyOnExhausted
properties.description: Whether to mark the route as unhealthy (down) when all restarting attempts (backoff) have failed and the route is not successfully started and the route manager is giving up. Setting this to true allows health checks to know about this and can report the Camel application as DOWN. The default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.routeFilterExcludePattern
properties.description: Used for filtering routes routes matching the given pattern, which follows the following rules: - Match by route id - Match by route input endpoint uri The matching is using exact match, by wildcard and regular expression as documented by PatternHelper#matchPattern(String,String) . For example to only include routes which starts with foo in their route id's, use: include=foo* And to exclude routes which starts from JMS endpoints, use: exclude=jms:* Multiple patterns can be separated by comma, for example to exclude both foo and bar routes, use: exclude=foo*,bar* Exclude takes precedence over include.

properties.name: camel.main.routeFilterIncludePattern
properties.description: Used for filtering routes matching the given pattern, which follows the following rules: - Match by route id - Match by route input endpoint uri The matching is using exact match, by wildcard and regular expression as documented by PatternHelper#matchPattern(String,String) . For example to only include routes which starts with foo in their route id's, use: include=foo* And to exclude routes which starts from JMS endpoints, use: exclude=jms:* Multiple patterns can be separated by comma, for example to exclude both foo and bar routes, use: exclude=foo*,bar* Exclude takes precedence over include.

properties.name: camel.main.routesBuilderClasses
properties.description: Sets classes names that implement RoutesBuilder .

properties.name: camel.main.routesBuilders
properties.description: Sets the RoutesBuilder instances.

properties.name: camel.main.routesCollectorEnabled
properties.description: Whether the routes collector is enabled or not. When enabled Camel will auto-discover routes (RouteBuilder instances from the registry and also load additional routes from the file system). The routes collector is default enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.routesCompileDirectory
properties.description: Directory to use for saving runtime compiled Camel routes to class files, when using camel-java-joor-dsl as Java DSL (such as when using Camel K with Java source routes). Camel will compile to in-memory only by default. Specifying this option, allows Camel to persist the compiled class to disk. And when starting the application again the routes are loaded from the pre-compiled class files instead of re-compiling again.

properties.name: camel.main.routesCompileLoadFirst
properties.description: Whether to load preexisting compiled Camel routes class files, when using camel-java-joor-dsl as Java DSL (such as when using Camel K with Java source routes). If enabled then Camel will look in the routes compile directory if a compiled Java route already exists and load its bytecode instead of runtime compiling from its java source file.

properties.name: camel.main.routesExcludePattern
properties.description: Used for exclusive filtering of routes from directories. The exclusive filtering takes precedence over inclusive filtering. The pattern is using Ant-path style pattern. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma, as example, to exclude all the routes from a directory whose name contains foo use: **/foo.

properties.name: camel.main.routesIncludePattern
properties.description: Used for inclusive filtering of routes from directories. The exclusive filtering takes precedence over inclusive filtering. The pattern is using Ant-path style pattern. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma, as example, to include all the routes from a directory whose name contains foo use: **/foo.

properties.name: camel.main.routesReloadDirectory
properties.description: Directory to scan for route changes. Camel cannot scan the classpath, so this must be configured to a file directory. Development with Maven as build tool, you can configure the directory to be src/main/resources to scan for Camel routes in XML or YAML files.

properties.name: camel.main.routesReloadDirectoryRecursive
properties.description: Whether the directory to scan should include sub directories. Depending on the number of sub directories, then this can cause the JVM to startup slower as Camel uses the JDK file-watch service to scan for file changes.

properties.name: camel.main.routesReloadEnabled
properties.description: Used for enabling automatic routes reloading. If enabled then Camel will watch for file changes in the given reload directory, and trigger reloading routes if files are changed.

properties.name: camel.main.routesReloadPattern
properties.description: Used for inclusive filtering of routes from directories. Typical used for specifying to accept routes in XML or YAML files, such as .yaml,.xml. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.main.routesReloadRemoveAllRoutes
properties.description: When reloading routes should all existing routes be stopped and removed. By default, Camel will stop and remove all existing routes before reloading routes. This ensures that only the reloaded routes will be active. If disabled then only routes with the same route id is updated, and any existing routes are continued to run.

properties.name: camel.main.routesReloadRestartDuration
properties.description: Whether to restart max duration when routes are reloaded. For example if max duration is 60 seconds, and a route is reloaded after 25 seconds, then this will restart the count and wait 60 seconds again.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdownLogInflightExchangesOnTimeout
properties.description: Sets whether to log information about the inflight Exchanges which are still running during a shutdown which didn't complete without the given timeout. This requires to enable the option inflightRepositoryBrowseEnabled.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdownNowOnTimeout
properties.description: Sets whether to force shutdown of all consumers when a timeout occurred and thus not all consumers was shutdown within that period. You should have good reasons to set this option to false as it means that the routes keep running and is halted abruptly when CamelContext has been shutdown.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdownRoutesInReverseOrder
properties.description: Sets whether routes should be shutdown in reverse or the same order as they were started.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdownSuppressLoggingOnTimeout
properties.description: Whether Camel should try to suppress logging during shutdown and timeout was triggered, meaning forced shutdown is happening. And during forced shutdown we want to avoid logging errors/warnings et all in the logs as a side-effect of the forced timeout. Notice the suppress is a best effort as there may still be some logs coming from 3rd party libraries and whatnot, which Camel cannot control. This option is default false.

properties.name: camel.main.shutdownTimeout
properties.description: Timeout in seconds to graceful shutdown all the Camel routes.

properties.name: camel.main.sourceLocationEnabled
properties.description: Whether to capture precise source location:line-number for all EIPs in Camel routes. Enabling this will impact parsing Java based routes (also Groovy, Kotlin, etc.) on startup as this uses JDK StackTraceElement to calculate the location from the Camel route, which comes with a performance cost. This only impact startup, not the performance of the routes at runtime.

properties.name: camel.main.startupRecorder
properties.description: To use startup recorder for capturing execution time during starting Camel. The recorder can be one of: false (or off), logging, java-flight-recorder (or jfr).

properties.name: camel.main.startupRecorderDir
properties.description: Directory to store the recording. By default the current directory will be used. Use false to turn off saving recording to disk.

properties.name: camel.main.startupRecorderDuration
properties.description: How long time to run the startup recorder. Use 0 (default) to keep the recorder running until the JVM is exited. Use -1 to stop the recorder right after Camel has been started (to only focus on potential Camel startup performance bottlenecks) Use a positive value to keep recording for N seconds. When the recorder is stopped then the recording is auto saved to disk (note: save to disk can be disabled by setting startupRecorderDir to false)

properties.name: camel.main.startupRecorderMaxDepth
properties.description: To filter our sub steps at a maximum depth. Use -1 for no maximum. Use 0 for no sub steps. Use 1 for max 1 sub step, and so forth. The default is -1.

properties.name: camel.main.startupRecorderProfile
properties.description: To use a specific Java Flight Recorder profile configuration, such as default or profile. The default is default.

properties.name: camel.main.startupRecorderRecording
properties.description: To enable Java Flight Recorder to start a recording and automatic dump the recording to disk after startup is complete. This requires that camel-jfr is on the classpath, and to enable this option.

properties.name: camel.main.startupSummaryLevel
properties.description: Controls the level of information logged during startup (and shutdown) of CamelContext.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingAnySpoolRules
properties.description: Sets whether if just any of the org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule rules returns true then shouldSpoolCache(long) returns true, to allow spooling to disk. If this option is false, then all the org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule must return true. The default value is false which means that all the rules must return true.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingBufferSize
properties.description: Sets the stream caching buffer size to use when allocating in-memory buffers used for in-memory stream caches. The default size is 4096.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingEnabled
properties.description: Sets whether stream caching is enabled or not. While stream types (like StreamSource, InputStream and Reader) are commonly used in messaging for performance reasons, they also have an important drawback: they can only be read once. In order to be able to work with message content multiple times, the stream needs to be cached. Streams are cached in memory only (by default). If streamCachingSpoolEnabled=true, then, for large stream messages (over 128 KB by default) will be cached in a temporary file instead, and Camel will handle deleting the temporary file once the cached stream is no longer necessary. Default is true.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingRemoveSpoolDirectoryWhenStopping
properties.description: Whether to remove stream caching temporary directory when stopping. This option is default true.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingSpoolCipher
properties.description: Sets a stream caching cipher name to use when spooling to disk to write with encryption. By default the data is not encrypted.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingSpoolDirectory
properties.description: Sets the stream caching spool (temporary) directory to use for overflow and spooling to disk. If no spool directory has been explicit configured, then a temporary directory is created in the java.io.tmpdir directory.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingSpoolEnabled
properties.description: To enable stream caching spooling to disk. This means, for large stream messages (over 128 KB by default) will be cached in a temporary file instead, and Camel will handle deleting the temporary file once the cached stream is no longer necessary. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingSpoolThreshold
properties.description: Stream caching threshold in bytes when overflow to disk is activated. The default threshold is 128kb. Use -1 to disable overflow to disk.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingSpoolUsedHeapMemoryLimit
properties.description: Sets what the upper bounds should be when streamCachingSpoolUsedHeapMemoryThreshold is in use.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingSpoolUsedHeapMemoryThreshold
properties.description: Sets a percentage (1-99) of used heap memory threshold to activate stream caching spooling to disk.

properties.name: camel.main.streamCachingStatisticsEnabled
properties.description: Sets whether stream caching statistics is enabled.

properties.name: camel.main.threadNamePattern
properties.description: Sets the thread name pattern used for creating the full thread name. The default pattern is: Camel (#camelId#) thread ##counter# - #name# Where #camelId# is the name of the CamelContext. and #counter# is a unique incrementing counter. and #name# is the regular thread name. You can also use #longName# which is the long thread name which can includes endpoint parameters etc.

properties.name: camel.main.tracing
properties.description: Sets whether tracing is enabled or not. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.main.tracingLoggingFormat
properties.description: To use a custom tracing logging format. The default format (arrow, routeId, label) is: %-4.4s %-12.12s %-33.33s

properties.name: camel.main.tracingPattern
properties.description: Tracing pattern to match which node EIPs to trace. For example to match all To EIP nodes, use to. The pattern matches by node and route id's Multiple patterns can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.main.tracingStandby
properties.description: Whether to set tracing on standby. If on standby then the tracer is installed and made available. Then the tracer can be enabled later at runtime via JMX or via Tracer#setEnabled(boolean) .

properties.name: camel.main.typeConverterStatisticsEnabled
properties.description: Sets whether type converter statistics is enabled. By default the type converter utilization statistics is disabled. Notice: If enabled then there is a slight performance impact under very heavy load.

properties.name: camel.main.useBreadcrumb
properties.description: Set whether breadcrumb is enabled. The default value is false.

properties.name: camel.main.useDataType
properties.description: Whether to enable using data type on Camel messages. Data type are automatic turned on if one ore more routes has been explicit configured with input and output types. Otherwise data type is default off.

properties.name: camel.main.useMdcLogging
properties.description: To turn on MDC logging

properties.name: camel.main.uuidGenerator
properties.description: UUID generator to use. default (32 bytes), short (16 bytes), classic (32 bytes or longer), simple (long incrementing counter), off (turned off for exchanges - only intended for performance profiling)

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.bulkheadEnabled
properties.description: Whether bulkhead is enabled or not on the circuit breaker. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.bulkheadExecutorService
properties.description: References to a custom thread pool to use when bulkhead is enabled.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.bulkheadMaxConcurrentCalls
properties.description: Configures the max amount of concurrent calls the bulkhead will support. Default value is 10.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.bulkheadWaitingTaskQueue
properties.description: Configures the task queue size for holding waiting tasks to be processed by the bulkhead. Default value is 10.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.circuitBreaker
properties.description: Refers to an existing io.smallrye.faulttolerance.core.circuit.breaker.CircuitBreaker instance to lookup and use from the registry. When using this, then any other circuit breaker options are not in use.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.delay
properties.description: Control how long the circuit breaker stays open. The value are in seconds and the default is 5 seconds.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.failureRatio
properties.description: Configures the failure rate threshold in percentage. If the failure rate is equal or greater than the threshold the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls. The threshold must be greater than 0 and not greater than 100. Default value is 50 percentage.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.requestVolumeThreshold
properties.description: Controls the size of the rolling window used when the circuit breaker is closed Default value is 20.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.successThreshold
properties.description: Controls the number of trial calls which are allowed when the circuit breaker is half-open Default value is 1.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.timeoutDuration
properties.description: Configures the thread execution timeout. Default value is 1000 milliseconds.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.timeoutEnabled
properties.description: Whether timeout is enabled or not on the circuit breaker. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.timeoutPoolSize
properties.description: Configures the pool size of the thread pool when timeout is enabled. Default value is 10.

properties.name: camel.faulttolerance.timeoutScheduledExecutorService
properties.description: References to a custom thread pool to use when timeout is enabled

properties.name: camel.health.componentsEnabled
properties.description: Whether components health check is enabled

properties.name: camel.health.consumersEnabled
properties.description: Whether consumers health check is enabled

properties.name: camel.health.enabled
properties.description: Whether health check is enabled globally

properties.name: camel.health.excludePattern
properties.description: Pattern to exclude health checks from being invoked by Camel when checking healths. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.health.exposureLevel
properties.description: Sets the level of details to exposure as result of invoking health checks. There are the following levels: full, default, oneline The full level will include all details and status from all the invoked health checks. The default level will report UP if everything is okay, and only include detailed information for health checks that was DOWN. The oneline level will only report either UP or DOWN.

properties.name: camel.health.initialState
properties.description: The initial state of health-checks (readiness). There are the following states: UP, DOWN, UNKNOWN. By default, the state is DOWN, is regarded as being pessimistic/careful. This means that the overall health checks may report as DOWN during startup and then only if everything is up and running flip to being UP. Setting the initial state to UP, is regarded as being optimistic. This means that the overall health checks may report as UP during startup and then if a consumer or other service is in fact un-healthy, then the health-checks can flip being DOWN. Setting the state to UNKNOWN means that some health-check would be reported in unknown state, especially during early bootstrap where a consumer may not be fully initialized or validated a connection to a remote system. This option allows to pre-configure the state for different modes.

properties.name: camel.health.registryEnabled
properties.description: Whether registry health check is enabled

properties.name: camel.health.routesEnabled
properties.description: Whether routes health check is enabled

properties.name: camel.lra.coordinatorContextPath
properties.description: The context-path for the LRA coordinator. Is default /lra-coordinator

properties.name: camel.lra.coordinatorUrl
properties.description: The URL for the LRA coordinator service that orchestrates the transactions

properties.name: camel.lra.localParticipantContextPath
properties.description: The context-path for the local participant. Is default /lra-participant

properties.name: camel.lra.localParticipantUrl
properties.description: The URL for the local participant

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.automaticTransitionFromOpenToHalfOpenEnabled
properties.description: Enables automatic transition from OPEN to HALF_OPEN state once the waitDurationInOpenState has passed.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.bulkheadEnabled
properties.description: Whether bulkhead is enabled or not on the circuit breaker.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.bulkheadMaxConcurrentCalls
properties.description: Configures the max amount of concurrent calls the bulkhead will support.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.bulkheadMaxWaitDuration
properties.description: Configures a maximum amount of time which the calling thread will wait to enter the bulkhead. If bulkhead has space available, entry is guaranteed and immediate. If bulkhead is full, calling threads will contest for space, if it becomes available. maxWaitDuration can be set to 0. Note: for threads running on an event-loop or equivalent (rx computation pool, etc), setting maxWaitDuration to 0 is highly recommended. Blocking an event-loop thread will most likely have a negative effect on application throughput.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.circuitBreaker
properties.description: Refers to an existing io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.CircuitBreaker instance to lookup and use from the registry. When using this, then any other circuit breaker options are not in use.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.config
properties.description: Refers to an existing io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.CircuitBreakerConfig instance to lookup and use from the registry.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.failureRateThreshold
properties.description: Configures the failure rate threshold in percentage. If the failure rate is equal or greater than the threshold the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls. The threshold must be greater than 0 and not greater than 100. Default value is 50 percentage.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.minimumNumberOfCalls
properties.description: Configures configures the minimum number of calls which are required (per sliding window period) before the CircuitBreaker can calculate the error rate. For example, if minimumNumberOfCalls is 10, then at least 10 calls must be recorded, before the failure rate can be calculated. If only 9 calls have been recorded the CircuitBreaker will not transition to open even if all 9 calls have failed. Default minimumNumberOfCalls is 100

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.permittedNumberOfCallsInHalfOpenState
properties.description: Configures the number of permitted calls when the CircuitBreaker is half open. The size must be greater than 0. Default size is 10.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.slidingWindowSize
properties.description: Configures the size of the sliding window which is used to record the outcome of calls when the CircuitBreaker is closed. slidingWindowSize configures the size of the sliding window. Sliding window can either be count-based or time-based. If slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the last slidingWindowSize calls are recorded and aggregated. If slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, the calls of the last slidingWindowSize seconds are recorded and aggregated. The slidingWindowSize must be greater than 0. The minimumNumberOfCalls must be greater than 0. If the slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the minimumNumberOfCalls cannot be greater than slidingWindowSize . If the slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, you can pick whatever you want. Default slidingWindowSize is 100.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.slidingWindowType
properties.description: Configures the type of the sliding window which is used to record the outcome of calls when the CircuitBreaker is closed. Sliding window can either be count-based or time-based. If slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED, the last slidingWindowSize calls are recorded and aggregated. If slidingWindowType is TIME_BASED, the calls of the last slidingWindowSize seconds are recorded and aggregated. Default slidingWindowType is COUNT_BASED.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.slowCallDurationThreshold
properties.description: Configures the duration threshold (seconds) above which calls are considered as slow and increase the slow calls percentage. Default value is 60 seconds.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.slowCallRateThreshold
properties.description: Configures a threshold in percentage. The CircuitBreaker considers a call as slow when the call duration is greater than slowCallDurationThreshold(Duration. When the percentage of slow calls is equal or greater the threshold, the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls. The threshold must be greater than 0 and not greater than 100. Default value is 100 percentage which means that all recorded calls must be slower than slowCallDurationThreshold.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.throwExceptionWhenHalfOpenOrOpenState
properties.description: Whether to throw io.github.resilience4j.circuitbreaker.CallNotPermittedException when the call is rejected due circuit breaker is half open or open.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.timeoutCancelRunningFuture
properties.description: Configures whether cancel is called on the running future. Defaults to true.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.timeoutDuration
properties.description: Configures the thread execution timeout (millis). Default value is 1000 millis (1 second).

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.timeoutEnabled
properties.description: Whether timeout is enabled or not on the circuit breaker. Default is false.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.timeoutExecutorService
properties.description: References to a custom thread pool to use when timeout is enabled (uses ForkJoinPool#commonPool() by default)

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.waitDurationInOpenState
properties.description: Configures the wait duration (in seconds) which specifies how long the CircuitBreaker should stay open, before it switches to half open. Default value is 60 seconds.

properties.name: camel.resilience4j.writableStackTraceEnabled
properties.description: Enables writable stack traces. When set to false, Exception.getStackTrace returns a zero length array. This may be used to reduce log spam when the circuit breaker is open as the cause of the exceptions is already known (the circuit breaker is short-circuiting calls).

properties.name: camel.rest.apiComponent
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST API (such as swagger or openapi)

properties.name: camel.rest.apiContextPath
properties.description: Sets a leading API context-path the REST API services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path.

properties.name: camel.rest.apiContextRouteId
properties.description: Sets the route id to use for the route that services the REST API. The route will by default use an auto assigned route id.

properties.name: camel.rest.apiHost
properties.description: To use a specific hostname for the API documentation (such as swagger or openapi) This can be used to override the generated host with this configured hostname

properties.name: camel.rest.apiProperties
properties.description: Sets additional options on api level

properties.name: camel.rest.apiVendorExtension
properties.description: Whether vendor extension is enabled in the Rest APIs. If enabled then Camel will include additional information as vendor extension (eg keys starting with x-) such as route ids, class names etc. Not all 3rd party API gateways and tools supports vendor-extensions when importing your API docs.

properties.name: camel.rest.bindingMode
properties.description: Sets the binding mode to be used by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.clientRequestValidation
properties.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check: 1) Content-Type header matches what the Rest DSL consumes; returns HTTP Status 415 if validation error. 2) Accept header matches what the Rest DSL produces; returns HTTP Status 406 if validation error. 3) Missing required data (query parameters, HTTP headers, body); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error. 4) Parsing error of the message body (JSon, XML or Auto binding mode must be enabled); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error.

properties.name: camel.rest.component
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.componentProperties
properties.description: Sets additional options on component level

properties.name: camel.rest.consumerProperties
properties.description: Sets additional options on consumer level

properties.name: camel.rest.contextPath
properties.description: Sets a leading context-path the REST services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path. Or for components such as camel-jetty or camel-netty-http that includes a HTTP server.

properties.name: camel.rest.corsHeaders
properties.description: Sets the CORS headers to use if CORS has been enabled.

properties.name: camel.rest.dataFormatProperties
properties.description: Sets additional options on data format level

properties.name: camel.rest.enableCORS
properties.description: To specify whether to enable CORS which means Camel will automatic include CORS in the HTTP headers in the response. This option is default false

properties.name: camel.rest.endpointProperties
properties.description: Sets additional options on endpoint level

properties.name: camel.rest.host
properties.description: Sets the hostname to use by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.hostNameResolver
properties.description: Sets the resolver to use for resolving hostname

properties.name: camel.rest.inlineRoutes
properties.description: Inline routes in rest-dsl which are linked using direct endpoints. By default, each service in Rest DSL is an individual route, meaning that you would have at least two routes per service (rest-dsl, and the route linked from rest-dsl). Enabling this allows Camel to optimize and inline this as a single route, however this requires to use direct endpoints, which must be unique per service. This option is default false.

properties.name: camel.rest.jsonDataFormat
properties.description: Sets a custom json data format to be used Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format, not to refer to an existing data format instance.

properties.name: camel.rest.port
properties.description: Sets the port to use by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.producerApiDoc
properties.description: Sets the location of the api document (swagger api) the REST producer will use to validate the REST uri and query parameters are valid accordingly to the api document. This requires adding camel-openapi-java, or camel-swagger-java to the classpath, and any miss configuration will let Camel fail on startup and report the error(s). The location of the api document is loaded from classpath by default, but you can use file: or http: to refer to resources to load from file or http url.

properties.name: camel.rest.producerComponent
properties.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST producer

properties.name: camel.rest.scheme
properties.description: Sets the scheme to use by the REST consumer

properties.name: camel.rest.skipBindingOnErrorCode
properties.description: Whether to skip binding output if there is a custom HTTP error code, and instead use the response body as-is. This option is default true.

properties.name: camel.rest.useXForwardHeaders
properties.description: Whether to use X-Forward headers to set host etc. for Swagger. This option is default true.

properties.name: camel.rest.xmlDataFormat
properties.description: Sets a custom xml data format to be used. Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format, not to refer to an existing data format instance.

properties.name: camel.threadpool.allowCoreThreadTimeOut
properties.description: Sets default whether to allow core threads to timeout

properties.name: camel.threadpool.config
properties.description: Adds a configuration for a specific thread pool profile (inherits default values)

properties.name: camel.threadpool.keepAliveTime
properties.description: Sets the default keep alive time for inactive threads

properties.name: camel.threadpool.maxPoolSize
properties.description: Sets the default maximum pool size

properties.name: camel.threadpool.maxQueueSize
properties.description: Sets the default maximum number of tasks in the work queue. Use -1 or an unbounded queue

properties.name: camel.threadpool.poolSize
properties.description: Sets the default core pool size (threads to keep minimum in pool)

properties.name: camel.threadpool.rejectedPolicy
properties.description: Sets the default handler for tasks which cannot be executed by the thread pool.

properties.name: camel.threadpool.timeUnit
properties.description: Sets the default time unit used for keep alive time

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.accessKey
properties.description: The AWS access key

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.defaultCredentialsProvider
properties.description: Define if we want to use the AWS Default Credentials Provider or not

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.refreshEnabled
properties.description: Whether to automatically reload Camel upon secrets being updated in AWS.

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.refreshPeriod
properties.description: The period (millis) between checking AWS for updated secrets.

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.region
properties.description: The AWS region

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.secretKey
properties.description: The AWS secret key

properties.name: camel.vault.aws.secrets
properties.description: Specify the secret names (or pattern) to check for updates. Multiple secrets can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.blobAccessKey
properties.description: The Eventhubs Blob Access Key for CheckpointStore purpose

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.blobAccountName
properties.description: The Eventhubs Blob Account Name for CheckpointStore purpose

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.blobContainerName
properties.description: The Eventhubs Blob Container Name for CheckpointStore purpose

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.clientId
properties.description: The client Id for accessing Azure Key Vault

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.clientSecret
properties.description: The client Secret for accessing Azure Key Vault

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.eventhubConnectionString
properties.description: The Eventhubs connection String for Key Vault Secret events notifications

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.refreshEnabled
properties.description: Whether to automatically reload Camel upon secrets being updated in Azure.

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.refreshPeriod
properties.description: The period (millis) between checking Azure for updated secrets.

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.secrets
properties.description: Specify the secret names (or pattern) to check for updates. Multiple secrets can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.tenantId
properties.description: The Tenant Id for accessing Azure Key Vault

properties.name: camel.vault.azure.vaultName
properties.description: The vault Name in Azure Key Vault

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.projectId
properties.description: The GCP Project ID

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.refreshEnabled
properties.description: Whether to automatically reload Camel upon secrets being updated in AWS.

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.refreshPeriod
properties.description: The period (millis) between checking Google for updated secrets.

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.secrets
properties.description: Specify the secret names (or pattern) to check for updates. Multiple secrets can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.serviceAccountKey
properties.description: The Service Account Key location

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.subscriptionName
properties.description: Define the Google Pubsub subscription Name to be used when checking for updates

properties.name: camel.vault.gcp.useDefaultInstance
properties.description: Define if we want to use the GCP Client Default Instance or not
